Yifan æ€»æ˜¯é¢å¸¦å¾®ç¬‘ï¼Œè®©äººæ„Ÿè§‰ç‰¹åˆ«èˆ’æœï¼Œç»†èŠ‚åšå¾—å¾ˆåˆ°ä½ï¼Œè®©æˆ‘ä»¬æ•´æ¡Œäººéƒ½è§‰å¾—è¢«ç…§é¡¾å¾—å¾ˆå¥½ã€‚
éå¸¸æ„Ÿè°¢è¿™æ ·ç”¨å¿ƒçš„æœåŠ¡ï¼Œè®©äººåƒå¾—å¼€å¿ƒã€ä¹Ÿæ„Ÿå—åˆ°æ¸©åº¦ï¼ğŸ’–

We had an amazing experience at Haidilao today! Our server Yifan was incredibly friendly, attentive, and professional. From the moment we sat down, Yifan made sure everything was perfect â€” refilled drinks on time, kept the table spotless, and always checked in with a smile.
Itâ€™s rare to see such genuine care and great service these days. Thank you, Yifan, for making our meal so enjoyable! ğŸ‘ğŸ‘
æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªå¸…å“¥æœåŠ¡å‘˜äº¦å‡¡æœåŠ¡è¶…çº§æ— æ•Œå¥½
Love this place down to the bidets in the bathroom

Haidilao never disappoints! The hotpot was delicious as always, with a fantastic selection. What truly made our night was the outstanding service from Yifan. Yifan was incredibly attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond to make sure we had a perfect dining experience. We'll definitely be back!

Great place if you're looking for a nice meal and service that excels.  Host and hostess are constantly making sure you feel welcomed even on the extremely busy night we went. Waiting area had some table games to keep you busy as well as lemon water, tea and some light snacks like candy and pretzals. They told us that wait time was about 45 min, but we got our table within 20 min.

Once seated, the food selection was super fresh.  Ordering was done through an iPad at the table but if you need help, a waiter is on hand to explain the types of food and drinks and answer any questions you may have.  Everything was out in a flash.  They charge you $2.99 per person to use the sauce bar, I would recommend if you've never been to a hotpot place but if you have, you can skip it, unless you want unlimited soft serve and extra crackers, which are included with the sauce bar.  The soup base was the most flavorful we have ever tried.  My wife had the bone broth with mushrooms and I had the tomato.  Did not need any dipping sauce with these two soup bases.  All in all, excellent food that you won't normally find at a standard hotpot place.  We had two types of Wagyu, shrimp, razor clams, crispy tofu skin and some veggies.  You can order hand pulled noodles as well as ramen and upon but we were stuffed.  I would definitely recommend.  Try reserving ahead of time because they are always busy.
love this place
Amazing service
large waiting area with snacks and drinks, very friendly and helpful staff.
happy halloweenï¼
Happy Halloween

This place was incredible. People were very kind. Food was awesome. I came on Halloween and they gave us balloons and treats too. They all had costumes and it was a great experience overall.

ğŸƒ Halloween Hotpot Night at Haidilao!

We came here on Halloween night and had such a great time! The service was amazing as always â€” super friendly and fast. The food was fresh, flavorful, and perfect for the chilly weather. The staff even added a little festive touch for the holiday, which made the atmosphere really fun and cozy. Definitely one of the best Haidilao experiences in New York! ğŸ‘»ğŸ”¥ğŸ²
Expensive but worth it because they pamper you. The food is good too. Very kid friendly, my son had a lot of fun and ate a lot.

Haidilao is a good spot for hot pot, especially for families. The staff is very attentive, making sure everyone feels taken care of, especially kidsâ€”they even bring small toys and kid-friendly meals, which is nice. It can be a bit tough to find the entrance, but once inside, the space is big and thereâ€™s seating while you wait. The $19.99 lunch combo has a good mix of proteins, veggies, and soup options, and itâ€™s pretty filling with all the sides like crackers and dessert. Overall, itâ€™s worth a visit, though making a reservation is recommended.
Awesome staffs, food was great & fast. Highly reccomend

the service here is definitely top notch! i went one time and as i was at the snack bar, a server came up and took my plate for me to place at my table~ very nice staff! i think the broth lacked a bit because my tomato base was too sweet but still worth it

As a customer who visits Haidilao once a month, I suggest that the waiters respond to the guests' requests. I asked the waiter to add some water for me and get me an ice cream, but no one did it until the end of the meal!

Best place for birthday celebrations!

We went to Haidilao again today because my friend just came back from China. It was a super busy Saturday, but Yu Xin still took great care of us in every possible way. His service was attentive, friendly, and professional as always. No matter how crowded it gets, he always makes us feel welcomed and well taken care of. Thank you, Yu Xin; youâ€™re the reason we keep coming back!
delicious

Haidilao Flushing is amazing! ğŸ”¥ğŸ² The soup base is super flavorful, service is top-notch ğŸ’¯ â€” they even do noodle dancing ğŸ’ƒğŸœ Always clean, friendly, and fun vibe! â¤ï¸ Perfect spot for hot pot lovers in NYC ğŸ—½ğŸ”¥
Delicious

meovv

great service quick food and amazing time

Haidilao never disappoints â€” from the moment we walked in, the service was top-notch. The staff were incredibly friendly, attentive, and went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. The hot pot ingredients were fresh and high-quality, with a great variety of meats, seafood, and veggies to choose from.
The highlight was definitely the little details: the complimentary snacks and drinks while waiting, the noodle dance performance, and the thoughtful touches like phone covers and hair ties. Itâ€™s these small things that make Haidilao stand out.

10/22/2025 update.
The complimentary set for children has dramatically changed, from the combo of protein, vege, carb, fruit, and yogurt drink to the combo of noodles, eggs, one slice of carrot and one slice of pumpkin. Incredible downgrade.

-
This is a great place to dine.

Excellent service and awesome dining environment. Fresh ingredients and delicious soup bases.

You can actually choose four soup bases, which is a great option if you couldnâ€™t decide what to choose from. Of course you need to pay more.

The price is a little bit high relatively, but I guess we pay all the complimentary service and goodies, like hand message service, iPhone screen protector service, free ice cream and fruits, crackers, candies and drinks etc.

Waiting area is a good place to relax. Message machines, kids playground for age 3-8, table games etc.
Cleanest hotpot to dine outside and very fresh amaaaazing service and there's nothing i could ask for more

Pros: Service was great.

Cons: Waiting time is too long. Assorted veggies ($12) are too poor (it costs like $1.5 for carrot, broccoli, and all the cheap stuff). Diced wagyu ($28) is poor quality, full of fats. Environment is too loud because of many people and music. Cannot focus on talking or eating.

Overall, I feel very disappointed. We two people spent $170 including tips and taxes. I donâ€™t think the restaurant worths the money. Seriously, better save money for omakase sushi.

We had the two-person lunch set menu. The service was excellent, and they also provided small side dishes and fresh fruit. I chose the set with fish fillets while my friend had the meat optionâ€”more than enough for two people to enjoy and left us feeling full and satisfied.

At the end, we also had ice cream, which was also delicious. Overall, a great experience.

I especially recommend the lunch setâ€”itâ€™s affordable, the service is outstanding, and the ingredients are fresh and clean.

We came to Hai Di Lao to celebrate a birthday and had the best experience! Our server Yu Xin was amazing; so attentive and thoughtful throughout the whole meal. The food was fresh and delicious, and Yu Xin went above and beyond by singing a birthday song for us, which made the atmosphere so fun and memorable. Truly a 10/10 experience. Highly recommend this location and a big thank you to Yu Xin for making our celebration extra special!

Haidilao is a famous Chinese hotpot restaurant with locations worldwide, with this one being one of the few on the East Coast, located in downtown Flushing. The store itself is quite spacious, with over 100 tables for people to sit at, and does get filled quite quickly. They offer private rooms as well as larger tables for larger parties.

The service is exceptional. The waiter and staff checked in on us nearly every second, offering us free goodies (that you need a secret code to get), as well as telling us about the many offerings they have.

The food, although on the pricier side, was of good quality and tasted great. We got the tom yum broth as well as the tomato broth. The tom yum broth was a bit too sour for our liking, but the tomato broth was amazing. The dancing noodle was nice and chewy, and they put on a show when they make it which was fun to watch. The rest of the products were typical hotpot offerings, but were of top quality and tasted great in the broth.

Monday, summer, late dinner (10pm), five of us stopped in here hotpot and every table was full (!). We ordered the prime beef, kurobata pork, shrimp, fish  fillets, tiny whole fishes, tripe and some vegetables. 50-50 hot/mild broths. Almost everything is included, but the sauce station was $3/person. Fresh fruit, chicken nuggets, little snacks and soft serve ice cream were also included in the price. Everything was fresh, flavorful and plentiful. Service was excellent and attentive. We had a private room and our server "Mengqi" was the best. She kept our plates refreshed with new ones and skimmed our brother when it became too frothy. She also brought us ice cream. In all, a delightful place to enjoy a great hotpot experience. Highly recommended.

Had an amazing experience at Haidilao! The hotpot was fresh and flavorful, but what really stood out was the service. Our server, Andrew, went above and beyond, he was attentive without being intrusive, explained the menu clearly, gave great recommendations, and checked on us often to make sure we had everything we needed. He was warm, professional, and genuinely made us feel welcomed. Andrew turned a great meal into an unforgettable dining experience. If youâ€™re visiting Haidilao, definitely hope you get Andrew as your server!
ä»å›½å†…å›æ¥ä¹‹åå‡ ä¹åœ¨çº½çº¦çš„é¥­åº—é‡Œä½“ä¼šåˆ°è¿™ä¹ˆå‘¨åˆ°çš„æœåŠ¡äº†ï¼Yunaå°å§å§è¶…å¥½ è¦å•¥ç»™å•¥ æˆ‘ä»¬çœŸæ˜¯æ—¢è¦åˆè¦ğŸ˜­ç»ç†ä¹Ÿå¾ˆå¥½

Itâ€™s an really popular place with long wait times but definitely worth it. The place is based entirely on a la carte menu, so any AYCE hot places doesnâ€™t even come close to its quality. I find the robot serving us to be really futuristic and cool. The noodle dance is a must get, it really hypes up the mood. The most enticing part of the Haidilao franchise is its service, and itâ€™s top notch as experienced by our visit. Really great for birthday parties.

Aug 9: A very nice experience at Haidilao. Love the atmosphere and our waitress Jing Xin is so nice, polite and always have a sweet smile on her face. We'll be back soon for Jackson Wang's MagicMan2 set meal. Kudos to the entire team!!
Update Aug 16: at Haidilao again for the Jackson Wang's MagicMan2 set meal. I met the most wonderful waiter in the world, Viktor. This is my third time here for the Jackson Wang meal, and the set meal is supposed to come w a JW cushion souvenir. Some how the shipment of cushions haven't arrived yet, so Viktor took my number and texted me in the evening when the cushions arrived. He kept his promise and label my name and number on the cushion for my friend to pick up on behalf.  Viktor's attitude and service deserves a good raiseğŸ‘ğŸ‘

The dining experience has consistently been exceptional. The pre-4 PM offering of $20 per person presents remarkable value. Furthermore, the establishment maintains a high standard of customer service, and the restaurant's cleanliness and operational efficiency are noteworthy.

Went there recently and had a great experience! The service was excellent and very attentive. I loved the snack bar the most, it was such a fun touch. The restaurant looked great, clean, and welcoming. The mala soup was delicious with bold flavors, though very spicy for me, so Iâ€™ll definitely go down a spice level next time. Overall, a wonderful spot to enjoy hot pot!

Haidilao never disappoints! The soup base is super flavorful, and the service is top-tier theyâ€™re always so attentive and friendly. Love the little snacks and ice cream too. Itâ€™s a bit pricey, but totally worth it for the experience!
Jean Zhao is an excellent pro! Very good service. Quality speaks for itself. Best desert bar in hotpot anywhere in NEW YORK CITY. 20% discount on Tuesday. Love it.

Truly one of a kind experience. The servers are VERY attentive, they give you aprons, hair ties and even a friend (panda) to eat with if you're dining alone. Everything tastes great and they even do noodle dances and other performances for special menu items, it's definitely unlike any restaurant I've ever been to before. A bit pricey since everything is basically a la carte though, so it's better to go with others to share the ingredients.

First of all I have to say who ever is in charge of the music; A+. But most of the credit goes to our server Alex whom served my daughter and I for Fatherâ€™s Day. And have to say Alex really made our evening extra special. We started with two brothers styles. The mushroom soup and level 3 spicy broth and got the works. Lobster, shrimp, lamb, steak and tons of mushrooms and veggies. Best hot pot in flushing queens

Haidilao is amazing! The environment is clean and cozy, and the service is incredibly attentive and warm. We went there for a birthday celebration â€” they prepared the space in advance, sang a birthday song, and even gave a gift. It truly felt like being at home. A big thank-you to Vivian and Dandan for always being so enthusiastic,. Miss Hana for her thoughtful and attentive service. Highly recommended!

Summer just got a whole lot cooler at Haidilao!â€¨They just unveiled their refreshing Coconut Drink Series and I had the chance to try themâ€”absolutely loving it! ğŸ¥¥âœ¨
Some of my favorites:â€¨ğŸŒ´ Tamarind Juice (so tangy & refreshing!)â€¨ğŸ¥­ Mango Coconut Breezeâ€¨ğŸ‘ Peachy Cocoâ€¨ğŸ¥¥ Longan Coconutâ€¨â€¦and so many more tropical sips to discover!

I went there to celebrate my relativeâ€™s birthday and it was a great experience, we bought a birthday cake from another store and brought it there and when we finished eating they brought it up along with a speaker playing happy birthday song with a person holding a happy birthday sign. We spent almost $400 including tips which was a bit expensive as I didnâ€™t think we ordered that much but the service was amazing. Food was not bad, itâ€™s just like normal hot pot but there was also free snacks and sauces at the booth which for us had watermelon, chicken nuggets and bean sprouts but I went there before and it varies depending on the seasons and when you go. The service was amazing, there was a waitress there who was almost always there at standby, she helped remove the trash and was always ready to help refill our water. I also tried this secret code I saw online which was to tell the waiter â€œå°ä»™å¥³æ¥åƒç«é”…äº†â€ (Little fairy is here for hot pot) which I think got us the small fairy wand. The other toys were probably given cause we had a lot of kids on the table, they also provided a free kids meal since we had a very little kid. There was also a performance which was really enjoyable to watch, it lasted about 5 minutes not sure when it happens but we went around 7-8pm.

Overall really good, for 8 people the price was 450$ so the price was around 56$ per person. Make sure to use the special codes when you are there, they DO give you free stuff. Also the bathrooms have complimentary cologne (if you ask), hair spray, toothbrush, razor, and floss, even mouthwash. The complimentary snacks, chicken nuggets, and boba is good too. Overall a really delicious spot for dinner.

haidilao is definitely worth the hype. im a fan. it felt more of like an experience than just a normal dinner with the decor, immaculate bathroom, and service. the servers were so nice and attentive. they told us how long to cook each dish and provided great recommendations. the dancing noodles was so fun and is a must get. we got four different soups and the one that stood out the most to me was the coconut chicken. it was sweet and comforting and made the chicken taste so good. i will definitely be back!

9/23ä¸‹åˆåœ¨æ³•æ‹‰ç››äº«ç”¨ç½é•å·²ä¹…çš„æµ·åº•æ’ˆç«é‹ï¼Œå¹³æ—¥çš„å€‹äººæˆ–è€…é›™äººï¼Œæˆ–è€…ä¸‰äººå¥—é¤çš„åƒ¹æ ¼çœŸçš„å¾ˆæ£’ï¼Œé€™è£¡æ¯ä¸€å€‹æœå‹™å“¡éƒ½ç‰¹åˆ¥çš„æœ‰ç¦®è²Œï¼Œåˆæ¨‚æ–¼åŠ©äººï¼Œæœ‰çœ¼åŠ›è¦‹ï¼Œå°¤å…¶æ˜¯æˆ‘å€‘é€™æ¡Œçš„æœå‹™Davidï¼Œä»–ç‰¹åˆ¥çš„å‹¤å¥®ï¼Œåˆæœ‰ç¦®è²Œï¼Œç¸½æ˜¯èƒ½å¤ å³æ™‚æ»¿è¶³é¡§å®¢çš„éœ€æ±‚ï¼ŒçœŸå¿ƒæ¨è–¦æœ‰å°å­©çš„çˆ¶æ¯è¦å¸¶å­©å­ä¾†æµ·åº•æ’ˆï¼Œé€™è£¡æœ‰åƒä¸å®Œçš„é›å¡Šï¼Œå°é›¶å˜´ï¼Œç°¡ç›´å°±æ˜¯å­©å­çš„ç¾é£Ÿè§£æ”¾åœ°

Came here to celebrate bfs birthday and honestly was so impressed. As soon as we got there, the staff asked if I was scared of dogs (there was one nearby), which I really appreciated because I actually am and they immediately helped us switch to another table. Super thoughtful, Iâ€™ve never had that happen anywhere else. Service throughout the night was amazing. They paid attention to everyone at the table and made us feel really taken care of. We brought our own birthday cake and they offered to keep it in their fridge, then later came out singing happy birthday and even gave us free ice cream. So sweet! Food was delicious as always. Definitely coming back!!!!

è¿™æ¬¡ç”¨é¤ä½“éªŒç‰¹åˆ«æ£’ï¼Œå°¤å…¶è¦è¡¨æ‰¬æˆ‘ä»¬çš„æœåŠ¡å‘˜ Celineã€‚å¥¹æ€åº¦çƒ­æƒ…ã€éå¸¸æœ‰è€å¿ƒï¼Œå¯¹æˆ‘ä»¬çš„éœ€æ±‚å“åº”å¾—ç‰¹åˆ«å¿«ã€‚æ— è®ºæ˜¯åŠ æ±¤ã€æ¢çº¸å·¾è¿˜æ˜¯å¸®æˆ‘ä»¬ä»‹ç»èœå•ï¼ŒCelineéƒ½æœåŠ¡å¾—éå¸¸å‘¨åˆ°ï¼Œè¿˜æ—¶ä¸æ—¶æ¥è¯¢é—®æˆ‘ä»¬æœ‰æ²¡æœ‰éœ€è¦ï¼ŒçœŸçš„è®©äººæ„Ÿå—åˆ°å®¾è‡³å¦‚å½’çš„æ„Ÿè§‰ã€‚

é£Ÿç‰©ä¸€å¦‚æ—¢å¾€çš„æ–°é²œç¾å‘³ï¼Œç¯å¢ƒä¹Ÿå¾ˆå¹²å‡€æ•´æ´ã€‚æœ‰Celineåœ¨ï¼Œæ•´ä¸ªç”¨é¤è¿‡ç¨‹æ›´åŠ æ„‰å¿«äº†ï¼ŒçœŸå¿ƒæ„Ÿè°¢å¥¹ï¼

Came here at 12am with my international friend from China. The service was fast, and the food delicious. I was given an apron (definitely recommend!) and some nuggets to start right away. Great place to have fun with friends.

Reservation is highly recommended here especially dinner time. Itâ€™s located on the 2nd floor. Waiting time can be very long like hours but they provided lounge with snacks and games. Service was excellent. I wish they have more selection of meats. They also offer complimentary soft serve.

æ„Ÿè§‰ç°åœ¨çš„æµ·åº•ææœåŠ¡çœŸçš„ä¸å¦‚ä»¥å‰äº†ã€‚ä»¥å‰æœåŠ¡å‘˜éƒ½ä¼šä¸»åŠ¨å¸®å¿™æ‰“æ±¤ï¼Œä¹Ÿä¼šåŠæ—¶è¡¥å……é¤å·¾çº¸ï¼Œä½†è¿™æ¬¡å®Œå…¨æ²¡æœ‰ã€‚èœå“æ–¹é¢æ›´è®©äººå¤±æœ›ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å¿«åƒå®Œæ—¶ï¼Œæœ€åä¸€å—è„†çš–é±¼ä¸‹é”…åï¼Œç«Ÿç„¶åœ¨èœç›˜å­é‡Œå‘ç°ä¸€æ ¹ç²—çŸ­çš„æ¯›å‘ã€‚æˆ‘å½“æ—¶æé†’äº†æœåŠ¡å‘˜ï¼Œé—®è¿™æ˜¯å¤´å‘è¿˜æ˜¯å…¶ä»–ä»€ä¹ˆä¸œè¥¿ï¼Œç»“æœä»–ä»¬ä»€ä¹ˆå¤„ç†éƒ½æ²¡æœ‰ï¼Œåªæ˜¯æŠŠç›˜å­æ”¶èµ°äº†ã€‚å› ä¸ºå·²ç»åƒåˆ°æœ€åï¼Œä¹Ÿæ²¡åŠæ³•å¤šè¯´ä»€ä¹ˆï¼Œä½†è¯´å®è¯çœŸçš„éå¸¸æ¶å¿ƒã€‚

The service at Haidilao isnâ€™t as good as it used to be. In the past, staff would always help serve the soup and proactively refill napkins, but this time they didnâ€™t. Whatâ€™s worse, when we were almost done eating, after putting the last piece of crispy perch into the pot, we suddenly found a short thick hair in the dish. I pointed it out to the server and asked if it was hair or something else, but they didnâ€™t handle it at allâ€”just took the plate away. Since we were already at the end of the meal, we didnâ€™t make a fuss, but honestly, it was really disgusting.
